info.author: Dustin Oprea
info.description:
This is an installable version of the 32-bit Windows M2Crypto binaries for Python made 
available by `grr <https://code.google.com/p/grr/wiki/BuildingWindowsClient#M2Crypto>`_.

This package is available on PyPI as `M2CryptoWin32 <https://pypi.python.org/pypi/M2CryptoWin32>`_.

See `M2CryptoWindows <https://github.com/dsoprea/M2CryptoWindows>`_ for more 
information.


---------------
Troubleshooting
---------------

If you see an error like the following during install, then you [allegedly] 
have an old version of setuptools::

    error: option --single-version-externally-managed not recognized

This seems to happen consistently for me, under Windows, even though it
*pip* seems to download the latest version of *setuptools* when you install it.

To get around this, use the `--egg` option::

    C:\>pip install --egg M2CryptoWin32
info.name: M2CryptoWin32
info.html_description:
This is an installable version of the 32-bit Windows M2Crypto binaries for Python made available by grr.

This package is available on PyPI as M2CryptoWin32.

See M2CryptoWindows for more information.

Troubleshooting

If you see an error like the following during install, then you [allegedly] have an old version of setuptools:

error: option --single-version-externally-managed not recognized

This seems to happen consistently for me, under Windows, even though it pip seems to download the latest version of setuptools when you install it.

To get around this, use the –egg option:

C:\>pip install --egg M2CryptoWin32
